subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] Re: on screen representation of senior quikscript
msgSnippet: ... Great! I ll add you within the next 24 hours, or probably sooner. I am getting ready to publish my font by putting it on the OFL server. My font will be
messageBody:
othermale wrote:
>

>
> This sounds like a great way to make it work. The senior font I've
> kludged together to work with my QS senior parser is quite an eyesore
> while your font is really great looking and I'd love to try to get a
> copy of it going with my parser. I have a sourceforge account user
> name othermale.
>

Great! I'll add you within the next 24 hours, or probably sooner. I am
getting ready to publish my font by putting it on the OFL server. My
font will be released under the OFL license, which basically says a user
can freely distribute and use the font, so long as he doesn't sell it
by itself. (Not that selling would likely happen in my case.) A user can
modify the font as long as he changes the name. I assume those terms are
okay with you? Though, if your font really resembles mine, we mind as
well release them with a similar name, to indicate they belong to the
same family.

Any ideas on a name for my font? readimproved, readtwo, shawtwo,
quicksccript, shawwill (as in Shaw's will) shawclear...

I just need a good name, then I can release it and have others have a
look and make suggestions.

Paul
